result.execSummary:
The defendant David Antonio Westmoreland Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David Antonio Westmoreland in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant David Antonio Westmoreland in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction CONSECUTIVE to any sentence with credit for 113 days served; STRAIGHT TIME; NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING; NO GOOD TIME ALLOWED.

Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge.
Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 04-13-2016 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

Defendant David A Westmoreland in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant David A Westmoreland in custody.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire and Addendum received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered count 2 Dismissed, But Read In. 

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and to pay the applicable surcharge. 

Bail conditions remain in effect. 

Case adjourned to branch 24 for Sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David Antonio Westmoreland in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BRODERICK S.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant David Antonio Westmoreland in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant David Antonio Westmoreland in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
